content.description: Start on good slots with a large ledge for your feet. Move up and right to match the next seam and make a long move to a sloped edge. Continue straight up to a big left facing edge and exit directly.

Start as for Tabernacle but move right handed to the (far left) slot on tabernacle and then a huge big left-handed jump (power glide!) from slots to jug block. Continue left and exit as for Destructive Creation. Epic line that covers the entire face of the overhang.
content.location: Right side of the boulder. Starts in same slots as Tabernacle

content.description: Start as for Las Vegas, stick the dyno then finish left through Destructive Creation.
Start as for Destructive Creation and climb into Heaven or Las Vegas

Start with your left hand on a good flat edge (same edge that you use with your right on destructive creation) and right on a rounded edge slightly below it. Pull on and dyno to the block in the middle of the face. Exit up and slightly right on incut crimps. 

 You can also exit via the big edge on Tabernacle which lowers the overall quality of the climb but doesn't change the grade.
Direct version of Goosebump. Start as for Goosebump but continue straight up from the bump move on crimps and slots to an easy exit.
content.location: Far left side of the boulder

content.description:
Start with left hand around the arete on a rounded edge, right on a terrible non-existent crimp. Pull on using some feet options to a left facing crimp and bump to a large slot jug (right). Cross under/match to connect with face holds and climb the arete to the lip. A super low start also appears possible but would be less cool. 

 A left variation staying on the left face of the boulder after the bump also exists at a similar grade - see "Goosebump Left" ~v8ish.
content.location: Left of Destructive Creation. Start with left around the arete on a rounded edge, right on a terrible non-existent crimp. Pull on using some feet options to a left facing crimp and bump to a large slot jug. Cross under to connect with face holds and climb the arete to the lip.

content.description: Start on a huge ledge on the far right side of the wall. Climb up sharp edges to an easy mantle. May suffice for a warm up... kind of
content.location: Farthest right line on the boulder

content.description: Stand start to Destructive Creation. Start standing or partially seated on a small boulder. Start right handed on a flat edge and left matched on a thin hold next to it. Pull on and grab a sharp sloped side pull and make a very long move to a good but precise slot. Find a way to unwind from that position and climb straight up.UPDATE FALL 2020: With the start hold to the Destructive Creation (sit) now quite a bit bigger than it originally was, the stand is really not materially harder than the full climb.
content.location: Far left side of the boulder - climb straight up the prow.

content.description: Start low on the left side of the boulder on a left facing incut and a barely there right hand crimp. Use a big left foot to pull on and stab for a precise, flat full pad edge. Climb straight up on edges. Best line Willard has to offer.
content.location: Left side of the choss boulder. Most obvious line on the block.

content.description: Sit start with both hands on a horizontal on some crimps in the seam. Toss for the lip of the boulder then topout.
content.location: This problem is found 8 feet right of "Tabernacle", just around the corner.

content.description:
Powerful lines on flat or incut edges up a steep wall. Many of the holds have broken over time (as you'll see). What's left is fairly solid at this point. Best try these in cold temps.

UPDATE - FALL 2020: The left start hold for both Destructive Creation Sit and Heaven or Las Vegas Sit has clearly been enlarged due to a break/loose chock stone coming out. As a result, both of these lines are substantially easier than they where prior to the break. Many projects STILL exist and I've tried to highlight them in the route descriptions. Many are stand alone projects and a few are link ups.
